title: Who Pays for Plastic Pollution? | Publications | WWF - World Wildlife Fund
body: Despite national and voluntary efforts, plastic pollution has only got worse and it's set to triple by 2040 unless urgent action is taken. readable_content:
- The website states that the use of the site is subject to WWF’s Privacy Policy and Site Terms. It mentions that the website monitors and stores data such as cookies for purposes including quality assurance, personalization, enhancement of user experience, and analytics.
- It outlines that continued use of the site constitutes acceptance of the Privacy Policy and Site Terms. It also includes a link for users to review the documents for details on how personal data is processed by the site or its third-party tools.
- The website discusses a WWF-commissioned report revealing the disparities in the true full lifetime cost of plastic between low- and high-income countries. It emphasizes the harmful effects of plastic production and pollution, particularly in low- and middle-income countries, and highlights the urgent need for global regulation and standards to address the plastic pollution crisis.
- It mentions the negotiations of a global treaty to end plastic pollution which commenced in March 2022, presenting an opportunity to address the crisis. The website also offers options for users to receive conservation news and updates, and it provides links to the WWF's social media channels.
- The website includes information about the World Wildlife Fund, its mission, and ways for the audience to support its conservation efforts.

Source: World Wildlife Fund Website, https://www.worldwildlife.org/
summary:
The text discusses the urgent need for global regulation and standards to address the plastic pollution crisis, emphasizing the harmful effects of plastic production and pollution. It also highlights the commencement of negotiations for a global treaty to end plastic pollution as an opportunity to address the crisis. Overall, the sentiment conveyed is supportive of addressing the issue of plastic pollution.
